chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig S. Erickson Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Craig S. Erickson Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Craig S. Erickson Jr. was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Expunction hearing.  ADA Phan states she believes deft does not qualify for expunction due to conviction in 08JV98.  Court takes no action at this time, Atty Marry to research the issue and may reschedule the expunction hearing.
to expunge court record of conviction; filed by Atty P Marry.
For Cts 1,2,3, 5 and 6 only - Dismissed.
$748.50  Failure to pay, civil judgment.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft has obtained his DL.  On State's motion, cts 1, 2, 3, 5 & 6 are dismissed, on ct 4 the enhancer possession of a controlled substance on or near certain places is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived.  Court imposes $100 fine plus costs; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge, 30 DTP or civil judgment.  Firearms warning given.  Expunction hearing 5/10/16 at 8:30am.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry states the deft has his DL, deft needs to submit to a polygraph exam, also is in process of starting a business with his mother.  FPT continued to 3/2/16 at 10am.  Bond continued.
With Atty Marry and ADA Delgado the FPT of 11/19/15 at 9:15am is rescheduled; as deft has his polygraph scheduled; reset to 1/20/16 at 9am.
At the request of Atty Marry and with OK of ADA Delgado, FPT on 10/8/15 is reset for 11/19/15 at 9:15.
With Atty Marry and ADA Delgado the FPT of 8/26/15 at 8:30am is rescheduled, as Atty Marry hasn't given  the name of the name of the polygraph examiner to the deft yet; reset to 10/8/15 at 8:30am.
With Atty Marry and by agreement of ADA Delgado the FPT of 7/16/15 at 8:30am is rescheduled, as the deft needs to do a polygraph; reset to 8-26-15 at 8:30am.
With Atty Marry and ADA Delgado the FPT of 6/3/15 at 8:30am is rescheduled to 7/16/15 at 8:30am.
With ADA Delgado and Atty Marry the FPT of 4/23/15 at 8:30am is rescheduled; to give Atty Marry time to obtain information the State requested pertaining to this case; reset to 6/3/15 at 8:30am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
With Atty Marry and by agreement of ADA Delgado the FPT of 3/12/15 at 8:45am is rescheduled; DA PTC set for 4/17/15 at 1:30pm and FPT reset to 4/23/15 at 8:30am.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry states he believes the case will be resolved; deft has his DL.  FPT continued to 3/12/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry states the deft has obtained his DL.  DA PTC 1/9/15 at 1:30pm and FPT 1/30/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry states the deft will be getting his DL tomorrow, is going to victim panel tonight.  FPT continued to 1/8/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry states the deft had a speeding ticket reopened in municipal court, believes he will be able to get his DL shortly; states he needs to get the squad video for this case.  FPT continued to 12/16/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Lassiter states she just received a global offer that deft needs time to consider.  FPT continued to 10/15/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 9/22/14 at 8:30am; DA PTC 9/19/14 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Assistant District Attorney Zachary Wittchow, special prosecutor, appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Lassiter acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  DA PTC 8/15/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 9/3/14 at 8am.  Bond continued.

Atty Zach Wittchow appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Carmen Lassiter. Clerk LE.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 7-30-14 @ 8:15am. Information filed. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing

Cash bond changed to signature bond.  Cash on deposit returned to poster.  gb/cp

150 p.m.  ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Lassiter. Clk  LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on 7/15/14 @ 9 a.m.  Bond - continued.  To be returned to poster per Judge Kluka - written on bond sheet.
Preliminary hearing on July 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Filed by Atty C Lassiter.
Atty:  C Lassiter.

2:26 pm    Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.   Defendant appeared in court in person.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Clerk: LE.    Initial appearance adjourned to 6-25-14 @ 1:00pm w/Comm Mason, 927-54th Street, Rm 157, Kenosha, WI.  Atty Status.  $2500 signature bond set with conditions.

*Not to possess or consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License or w/o ignition interlock device.
343.44(1)(b) OAR, Repeater   /   946.49(1)(a)  Misd BJ, Repeater  4 Cts   /   961.41(3g)(e) Poss of THC, - 2bnd & Subs, Poss of Controlled Substance on or near certain places.

2:54 pm   Assistant District Attorney Zachary Wittchow, special prosecutor, appeared for the State.  No appearance by DE.  Clerk:  LE.    Initial appearance adjourned to 6-19-14 @ 1:00pm w/Comm Mason, 927-54th Street, Rm 157, Kenosha, WI per date on citation.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 19, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
